isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION, TANDEM AXLE: INTERNATIONAL - ASSEMBLE - INTER-AXLE DIFFERENTIAL

step1.para: Position inter-axle differential case on two 4" x 4" blocks for re-assembly ( Figure 29).
Install new rear differential gear bearing cup into case.

important.para: New input shaft and rear differential gear, designed to help prevent excessive end play, were released to production September 1, 1991. These new components have mated machined surfaces ( Figure 30) that do not use inter-axle gears to control end play.

figure.caption: Figure 30. New and Original Design Input Shaft and Rear Differential Gear

caution.para: These changes are not "stand alone" product improvements, they must be used together for proper service of N model axles built before the specified date.

step1.para: Press new bearing cone onto rear differential gear.

note.para: Be certain both cup and cone are properly seated or false reading on end play of inter-axle may occur.

step1.para: Apply light coating of gear lube to rear side gear bearing and hub surface and install.
Install and lubricate inter-axle differential assembly, with large rivet heads to rear of case.
Install steel lube retainer plate ( Figure 31).

note.para: Use tool numbers ZTSE 4273-1A and ZTSE 4273-2 in combination so surface of lube retainer is not damaged. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS, 11.3..

step1.para: Press new needle bearing into I.D. of drive gear ( Figure 32).

figure.caption: Figure 32. Press Needle Bearing Into I.D. of Drive Gear

note.para: Needle bearing must be pressed from flat end of bearing, where part numbers are located, using tool number ZTSE 4273-4.

step1.para: Lubricate needle bearing and carefully lower drive gear into intermediate case until integral differential gear is engaged in inter-axle differential.

note.para: Rubber lube retainer is no longer required.

step1.para: If equipped with optional lube pump, install lube pump drive gear into position on stepped portion of large splines.
Press new input shaft front bearing cone onto shaft until it seats completely against shoulder.
Lube thrust washer lightly ( Figure 33) and place on front of drive gear with radius or large chamfer at I.D. of thrust washer away from drive gear.

note.para: To establish proper end play, input shaft will be installed into inter-axle differential prior to installing shift collar, fork, and shift shaft.

step1.para: Lube and install input shaft, turning slightly to engage splines.
Install new input shaft front bearing cup into input shaft bearing retainer without shims.

note.para: Bearing cup is press fit on units manufactured after July 1991.

step1.para: Install bearing retainer onto intermediate housing and bolt into place.
Thread input nut onto input shaft until resistance is felt from locking compound. Tap nut lightly with soft hammer.
Position dial indicator onto end of input shaft ( Figure 34). Using suitable pry bar and spacer, pry input shaft out and record end play.

figure.caption: Figure 34. Position Dial Indicator Onto End of Input Shaft

step1.para: Proper end play for inter-axle is .001 to .003 inch (.025 to .076 mm). Subtract .003 inch (.076 mm) from recorded end play and assemble combination of shims that total proper thickness to establish correct end play.
Example: .080 in.(2.032 mm)
Measurement with dial indicator
Preferred end play. -.003 in. (.076 mm)
Required shims. .077 in. (1.956 mm)
Remove input shaft bearing retainer and install shim pack between bearing retainer and input shaft bearing cup. Remove input shaft.
Check composite pads on shift fork for excessive wear. Replace if necessary.
Check shift collar for wear or damage in groove, on drive lugs, and splines. Replace if necessary.

Assemble fork and shift collar with drive lugs toward drive gear and raised section of fork toward front of carrier assembly ( Figure 35). Install into intermediate case. Lock drive lugs into drive gear lugs.

figure.caption: Figure 35. Raised Section Toward Front of Carrier Assembly

step1.para: Install "C" clip snap ring into groove in shift shaft. Slide spring into place on shift shaft.
Clean thread on shift shaft and apply a small amount of general purpose Lock n' Seal®. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION AND SEALERS in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Install shift shaft into bore and thread into shift fork. Tighten to 30 to 38 ft-lbs. (41 to 52 N•m) with screwdriver socket.
Again be certain thrust washer is in place on front of drive gear with I.D. radius or large chamfer toward front and reinstall input shaft.

note.para: It may be necessary to rotate drive gear to align all splines and drive lugs.

step1.para: Install new oil seal into input shaft bearing retainer.

Apply 1/16" bead of Loctite 518 gasket eliminator to mating surface on rear side of input shaft bearing retainer ( Figure 36). Position retainer onto intermediate case. Install bolts and tighten to 100 to 120 ft-lbs. (136 to 163 N•m). Again check end play to assure proper setting.
Check seal surface on input yoke. Replace if grooved or damaged.
Install yoke using installation tool number ZTSE 4336. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS.
Install new torque prevailing nut, and tighten to 900 to 1200 ft-lbs. (1224 to 1632 N•m).
Clean and install magnetic screen filter on models equipped with lube pump. Tighten to 15 to 20 ft-lbs. (20 to 27 N•m).
Clean mating surfaces and install 1/16" bead of Loctite 518 gasket eliminator onto intermediate case ( Figure 37).
Install lube pump on models so equipped, or cover plate and tighten bolts evenly to 15 to 20 ft-lbs. (20 to 27 N•m).
Install air shift cylinder onto intermediate case. Be certain metal piston support washer is in position, and white cylinder seal is in place. Tighten bolts evenly to 30 to 40 ft-lbs. (41 to 55 N•m).
